newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Citicorp Equity extends bonds.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Citicorp Equity extends bonds.

text.p: Argentina's Citicorp Equity Investments SA said Monday its shareholders have approved an increase in the size of a non-convertible bond program first launched in April 1995 by $300 million, to $500 million.

The five-year program now specifies that up to $500 million of bonds denominated in dollars or other currencies can be in circulation at any time. The issues will have minimum maturities of 30 days and no more than 10 years, Citicorp Equity Investments said in a letter to the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange.
The bonds may have fixed or floating interest or may be discount instruments. They will be listed in Buenos Aires and on foreign stock exchanges.
The capital from the issues will be used to finance investment in fixed assets, to accumulate working capital and to refinance liabilities.
